sentence.Network_en: Mrs Zuckerman does not fraternize widely.
sentence.Network_cn: 朱克曼夫人结交并不广泛。

sentence.Network_en: Soldiers who fraternize with the enemy will be punished.
sentence.Network_cn: 亲敌的士兵将受到惩罚.

sentence.Network_en: He combined consummate shrewdness with the disposition superficially to fraternize.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把高度的精明和温和敦厚的外表结合了起来.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from French fraterniser, from medieval Latin fraternizare, from Latin fraternus 'brotherly' (see fraternal)

entry.def: If you fraternize with someone, you associate with them in a friendly way.

example.ex: At these conventions, executives fraternized with the key personnel of other banks...
example.tran: 在这些集会上，主管们和其他银行的重要人员友善往来。

example.ex: Mrs Zuckerman does not fraternize widely...
example.tran: 朱克曼夫人结交并不广泛。

means.word_mean: 1. be on friendly terms with someone, as if with a brother, especially with an enemy

auth_sentence.content: Too little of a democrat to fraternize with an affiliated society of the soi-disant Friends of the People.
auth_sentence.res_content: Too little of a democrat to fraternize with an affiliated society of the soi-disant Friends of the People.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Too little of a democrat to fraternize with an affiliated society of the soi-disant Friends of the People.

sentences.en: Soldiers from the two armies stopped fighting and fraternized.
sentences.cn: 两军士兵停止作战，并友好地交往。

sentences.en: The soldiers were forbidden to fraternize.
sentences.cn: 士兵被禁止与敌兵亲善。
